critique: This document pertains to the regulation of aircraft entering the Canal Zone in 1939. It amends a previous executive order, granting the Secretary of State or the Civil Aeronautics Authority, with the agreement of the Secretary of War, the power to waive certain sections of the order. Given the historical context and the specific nature of the order, it's difficult to assign strong ideological biases. The document seems primarily concerned with administrative procedure and national security during a period of international tension leading up to World War II. Therefore, most axes will be scored as neutral, with a slight lean towards national security due to the context of regulating air traffic into a strategically important area.
